Hello Guys,

Does anyone know if it is possible to create “Custom Workflow Actions” for HubSpot’s private apps? I am currently doing a custom integration for my company and ran into a road block when trying to use the /automation/v4/actions/{appId}?hapikey={apiKey} API endpoint. So far, i was able to use the Bearer Token for the private app to create custom objects and access built-in object types.

The error I got when I tried using the custom action API is: “This API can’t be called using an OAuth access token. A valid developer API key must be provided in the `hapikey` query parameter, and a valid `appId` must be provided in the API request.”

Does this mean I will have to create a public app in order to access it? Further, i tried the main API key on the account and that didn’t work either.

Kind regards,
pretty sure you need to use a developer account and developer API Key for the custom action API, its a whole separate process to sign up for developer account

<@U034X9K26MD> i see. I did create a developer account. However, I do not see an option to setup for private usage. Our integrations are for in-house only. Is it possible to create an App under our developer account without publishing it to the market place? This is the primary reason why we were trying to use the private apps feature of HubSpot.

it is possible, publishing an app to the marketplace is a whole separate process, by default apps are ‘private’. the name private app is pretty confusing, it doesn’t really mean an app, just an authentication method and its separate from the idea of making an app with your developer account and keeping it private

<@U034X9K26MD> Ah! i see. I have one final question. Let’s say I created an app using our developer account. Are all the APIs available by default to HubSpot accounts of any subscription level? Or, is it the case where some APIs require the consuming HubSpot account to have a specific subscription level?
I believe all the APIs except the webhook api are available at all levels
<@U034X9K26MD> thank you for the information. You’ve been very helpful. :beers:
Hello. Does anyone know, is it possible to add the choosen values in a form to the url parameters. I want to show the website depend on the selected options in the form? Thx.

You can probably use form events for the form submission, then grab the field value and populate it on the URL: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/global-form-events>

A slightly different use case but I wrote a post on how to redirect to different URLs based on a dropdown choice, which is similar and would just need to be re-written a little: <https://www.stephanieogaygarcia.com/HubSpot-website-development/redirect-a-HubSpot-form-to-a-thank-you-page-based-on-a-form-field>
